titleStmt.title: W. D. Robinson et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8932

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To His Excelency James F. Robertson
Governor of Kentucky

Your undersigned petitioners State that the undersigned W. F Robinson is a pracising Physician in Pulaski county Kentucky and as such generally Keeps on hands liquors for medical purposes and that the neighbours are in the habit of getting their medicinal liquors from him that on the day of June 1863 having been brought up on a warrant before the Honorable Judge of the Pulaski county Court upon a charge of selling contrary to law he was fined ($60.) Sixty dollars Now your Petitioners States that while they do not impute fault to the officers of the law, they Still think it a verry hard case and regret the finding exceedingly the state that they do not belive the Doctor ever intended to violate the law but admit that he has been on some occasions too easily persuaded out of drams by particular friends but they have no knowledge of any getting drunk or tipling about his house they State that it has been a great advantage to neighbourhood and they know of no evil resulting to the country from his keeping the liquor they further State that the Doctor is a cripple and has a
considerable family to Support from his profession alone and it would be a verry hard case on him to have the fine to pay and they most respectfully and earnestly pray your Excellency to remit it

W D Robinson
H. Simpson
John. Murphy
Robert McQueary
Henry McQueary
James, H, McPherson
William McQuary
Andrew Randolph
J. E. Owens
Nicklas Estap
P. T. Stagschill

Pulaski Cir Ct
Pettn to remit fine of W. F. Robinson
$60 } Tipling
Fine remitted except ten dollars & costs

J F Robinson
W. F. Robinson
Iss July 3. 1863_
